projects.title: just some shapes
projects.info: playing around with webgl, three.js and javascript

projects.title: paint4me: an online painting app
projects.writeup: i was bored and wanted to make something cute, and i decided to use react since i needed to learn it anyway. i started by setting up a basic canvas that can draw lines, then added palette, eraser, and image save options. eventually the images will be uploaded to aws (so i can see everyone's drawings) and the pen tool will have an increased customizability.

projects.title: news article analyzer: sentiment analysis using ibm watson
projects.info: takeaways: watson api, natural language understanding, developing an app in 24 hours!!!
projects.writeup: during my internship at ibm, we got to participate in a hackathon with access to various ibm watson apis. we decided to analyze a body of text based on sentiment and keywords, as a way for people to closer examine the quality of their news and find topics for future research. my role in the team was server-side programming, including handling calls to and responses from the ibm watson api, and returning data to the frontend.

projects.title: college students: a data science project on demographics
projects.info: takeaways: python, tensorflow, tableau, spark, mapreduce, impala, vega, machine learning models, data visualization
projects.writeup: blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah

projects.title: collapsible technology and the portable lunch problem space
projects.info: takeaways: design thinking, supply chain analysis, market analysis, ip research, business model synthesis
projects.writeup: based on initial problem space and stakeholder research, we identified the portable lunch space as a potential whitespace for innovation. we iterated upon prototypes based on user centered design research and benchmarking features across competitors. we also performed a supply chain analysis to determine the best manufacturing materials and processes, which helped us finalize our prototype design.

projects.title: palm: accessibility in the palm of your hand
projects.info: takeaways: design thinking, prototyping, user testing, keeping fingers safe while sawing apart plastic and metal
projects.writeup: for my design thinking class with a focus on human interaction and user testing, we were tasked with developing a container-opening solution for individuals with hand mobility impairment. we developed a rough prototype of a sliding lid that could be opened with the palm of the hand.

projects.title: mealhop: a food ordering coordinater for your chat group
projects.info: takeaways: javascript, using an api [cisco spark], developing an mvp in 36 hours
projects.writeup: i participated in my first hackathon in 2017 with two friends. we wanted to utilize the cisco spark api to create a simple project that we could comfortably finish within 48 hours, so we built a chat bot for cisco spark that allowed groups to coordinate lunch orders. this was our first real experience with javascript, and it was a very fun but also educational experience.

projects.title: spotify analytics: a web app to view your spotify listening data
projects.info: takeaways: javascript, using an api [spotify], express, node.js, pug
